intro: Agrostophyllum loheri, commonly known as the narrow-leaved rockheath. It is a flowering plant native to southern Africa, particularly South Africa, where it thrives in rocky and sandy soils. The plant is characterized by its small, narrow leaves and clusters of white or pale yellow flowers that bloom in spring. It is often found in coastal and mountainous regions, adapting well to harsh environmental conditions. Due to its limited distribution and specific habitat requirements, it is considered a rare and ecologically significant species.
